diff_user.system:
You are an expert data engineer specializing in converting data to text. Your task is to create a Python program that converts structured triples data into natural language text. The general topic is Airports. The program should implement a function called 'predict' that accepts a list of triples and generates a coherent, contextually relevant sentence that accurately represents the information contained in the triples. Ensure that the generated text is fluent, grammatically correct, and maintains the meaning of the original data. The function returns that sentence as a string. Below is the list of all possible predicates that can be given as an input. With the given predicates and examples implement the 'predict' function so it can process all the possible predicates:

Predicate: cityServed
Example text: The Aarhus is the airport of Aarhus, Denmark.
Predicate: elevationAboveTheSeaLevel
Example text: Aarhus Airport is 25 metres above sea level.
Predicate: location
Example text: Aarhus Airport is located in Tirstrup.
Predicate: operatingOrganisation
Example text: Aarhus Airport is operated by Aarhus Lufthavn A/S.
Predicate: runwayLength
Example text: Aarhus Airport runway length is 2776.0.
Predicate: runwayName
Example text: Aarhus Airport runway name is 10L/28R.
Predicate: country
Example text: Abilene, Texas is in the United States.
Predicate: isPartOf
Example text: Abilene, Texas is part of Jones County, Texas.
Predicate: 1stRunwayLengthFeet
Example text: The length of the 1st runway at Abilene Regional airport is 3678 feet.
Predicate: 1stRunwaySurfaceType
Example text: The first runway at Abilene Regional Airport is made from asphalt.
Predicate: 3rdRunwayLengthFeet
Example text: The third runway at Abilene Regional Airport is 7,202 feet long.
Predicate: icaoLocationIdentifier
Example text: Abilene Regional Airport ICAO Location Identifier is KABI.
Predicate: locationIdentifier
Example text: The location identifier for Abilene Regional airport is ABI.
Predicate: elevationAboveTheSeaLevelInFeet
Example text: Afonso Pena International Airport is elevated 2988 feet above sea level.
Predicate: iataLocationIdentifier
Example text: Agra Airport IATA Location Identifier is AGR.
Predicate: nativeName
Example text: Kheria Air Force Station is the native name of Agra Airport.
Predicate: leaderParty
Example text: The leader party at Alcobendas is the Peoples Party (Spain).
Predicate: capital
Example text: Saint Anne is the capital of Alderney.
Predicate: language
Example text: The main language spoken on Alderney is English.
Predicate: leader
Example text: Alderney's leader name is Elizabeth II.
Predicate: owner
Example text: Alpena County Regional Airport owner is Alpena County, Michigan.
Predicate: 1stRunwayLengthMetre
Example text: The length of the first runway at Amsterdam Airport Schiphol is 3800 metres.
Predicate: 4thRunwaySurfaceType
Example text: The fourth runway at Schiphol Airport in Amsterdam is made of asphalt.
Predicate: 5thRunwayNumber
Example text: Amsterdam Airport Schiphol is 5th runway number 18.
Predicate: largestCity
Example text: The largest city in Andrews County, Texas is Andrews.
Predicate: 4thRunwayLengthFeet
Example text: Andrews County Airport is 4th runway length feet of 25.
Predicate: 1stRunwayNumber
Example text: Angola International Airport 1st runway is Number 5.
Predicate: elevationAboveTheSeaLevelInMetres
Example text: Angola International airport is 159 metres above sea level.
Predicate: administrativeArrondissement
Example text: Antwerp is admin Arrondissement of Arrondissement.
Predicate: mayor
Example text: The mayor of Antwerp is Bart De Wever.
Predicate: 2ndRunwaySurfaceType
Example text: Poaceae is the surface type of the second runway of Ardmore Airport, New Zealand.
Predicate: 3rdRunwaySurfaceType
Example text: Ardmore Airport (New Zealand)'s 3rd runway surface type is Poaceae.
Predicate: runwaySurfaceType
Example text: The runway surface at Atlantic City International Airport is made from asphalt and concrete.
Predicate: officialLanguage
Example text: French is the official language of Belgium.
Predicate: city
Example text: ENAIRE is in the city of Madrid.
Predicate: jurisdiction
Example text: Flemish Government jurisdiction is Flanders.
Predicate: demonym
Example text: Greece demonym is Greeks.
Predicate: aircraftHelicopter
Example text: India's Air Force has an aircraft-capable helicopter known as the HAL Light Combat Helicopter.
Predicate: transportAircraft
Example text: The Boeing C-17 Globemaster III is a transport aircraft in the Indian Air Force.
Predicate: currency
Example text: The currency in Iraq is the Iraqi dinar.
Predicate: headquarter
Example text: The Pakistan Civil Aviation Authority is headquartered at Jinnah International Airport.
Predicate: class
Example text: Poaceae class is Monocotyledon.
Predicate: division
Example text: Poaceae belongs to the division of flowering plants.
Predicate: order
Example text: Poaceae belongs to the order of Commelinids.
Predicate: regionServed
Example text: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey serves the New York region.
Predicate: leaderTitle
Example text: The Punjab, Pakistan, is led by the Provincial Assembly of the Punjab.
Predicate: hubAirport
Example text: The hub airport for Turkmenistan airlines is Ashgabat International airport.
Predicate: aircraftFighter
Example text: United States Air FOrce aircraft fighter is General Dynamics F-16 Fighting Falcon.
Predicate: attackAircraft
Example text: The Lockheed AC-130 can be found on USAF aircraft carriers.
Predicate: battle
Example text: One of the noted United States Air Force battles was the Invasion of Grenada.

responses:
To improve the FITNESS SCORE of the program, we can enhance the predict function to handle different predicate types and generate more diverse and accurate sentences. Here's a targeted improvement:

<<<<<<< SEARCH
def predict(triple: Triple) -> str:
    return f"The {triple.predicate} of {triple.subject} is {triple.object}."
>>>>>>> REPLACE

>>>>>>> SEARCH
The `predict` function can be improved by handling specific predicates differently. For example, we can handle predicates related to measurement (e.g., elevationAboveTheSeaLevel, runwayLength) by adding units to the object. This will make the generated sentences more accurate and informative.

Here's the improved code:

<<<<<<< SEARCH
def predict(triple: Triple) -> str:
    return f"The {triple.predicate} of {triple.subject} is {triple.object}."
>>>>>>> REPLACE

>>>>>>> SEARCH
=======
def predict(triple: Triple) -> str:
    # Handle measurement predicates
    if triple.predicate in ['elevationAboveTheSeaLevel', 'elevationAboveTheSeaLevelInFeet', 'elevationAboveTheSeaLevelInMetres', 'runwayLength', '1stRunwayLengthFeet', '1stRunwayLengthMetre', '3rdRunwayLengthFeet', '4thRunwayLengthFeet']:
        return f"{triple.subject} is {triple.object} {triple.predicate} above sea level."
    # Handle other predicates
    else:
        return f"The {triple.predicate} of {triple.subject} is {triple.object}."
>>>>>>> REPLACE
